title: Cannot Customise. Utterly cluttered.
text:
Things I hate:
I cannot customise the screen I open to. I keep getting this annoying screen where I have already seen the notifications listed a bazillion times. Also, I can‚Äôt delete the notifications, even if they have been read. It looks cluttered and drives me crazy. 

Even if I click on ‚Äúhide read,‚Äù they pop back up
like a bad carbuncle every time I reopen the app.

Everyone and their mother has an all with phone capabilities. I don‚Äôt need another ersatz phone app. 

This app is trying to do too much. It wants to be WhatsApp combined with zoom combined with all of the Microsoft office suite. I hate it.

title: Super frustrated with recent update
text: I use Teams on my phone to take work meetings without needing to sign into a Microsoft account. It used to work great. Since a recent update though, joining a meeting without signing in is a terrible process. When I click the Join link in my email, it no longer puts me directly into the meeting; it makes me enter the Meeting ID and Passcode manually. To do that, I need to copy the ID from my email, switch apps, and paste it into Teams, then switch back to email, copy the passcode‚Ä¶ and AUGH when I switch back to Teams, it has backed out automatically to the Sign In screen, which means my Meeting ID is gone. I literally had to copy the Meeting ID and Passcode into a notes app, put them together as one string of text, copy that text, paste it into the Teams Meeting ID field, then select and cut the Passcode part on its own so that I could paste in both pieces of data that I needed without leaving the Teams app (and losing my progress). Microsoft WHY did you make joining a meeting without signing in so difficult and bad?? I promise you that no matter how annoying you make it, I am not going to sign in on my phone, even though that‚Äôs clearly what you want and what you‚Äôre prioritizing. Please fix this, thank you.

title: Easy to use
text: Teams just keeps improving and I love how easy it is to switch between accounts

title: Hope we can keep teams going

title: Microsoft Teams - Amazing work app
text: Great tool to communicate with co workers, team groups, sharing files, virtual training and make video calls.

title: Basically good
text:
Most of the functionality is good.  Initially it was big problem until Microsoft added the feature to add a device to a call.  Sometimes it stops working when there is a teams update.

One complaint I have with teams in general is that it has made communication more messy.  People never know when to send a teams message vs an email.  And with point to point communication a lot of people are also missing out on items they should be included in.

title: Generally very good but some annoying bugs
text: The biggest issue I have right now is not being able to add people to a meeting chat. Some names are just not available. It is weird. They are people that I chat with frequently. This appears to happen only for meeting chats. It would be logical if I could add nobody or anybody, but Teams has decided only some people will never be added to a meeting chat.

title: Downhill!
text: Used to love this product and wow is it buggy. The new interface on the phone is terrible half the time you end up hanging up on someone while trying to answer the call.

title: Review
text: Microsoft Teams is one of the best app that I have ever used. It is good for business, education and discussions for groups. I can join Teams with my IPad, laptops and phones. There were no errors while I were using. I really recommend others to use this app. I have been using this app for 5 years.

title: 6.1.1 Ruined Calendar Experience
text:
The latest update to Teams has broken many things for me with calendar. The time indicator (red line showing current time) is not the same as system time (it is correct in Teams for Windows, but iOS app is significantly behind schedule (shows 6am at 12pm) it took me some time to notice it‚Äôs only the red bar that is not tracking. This is how I first noticed something was different, but the biggest issue is the app refresh time is broken. Previously I could have the calendar open and it would stay updated with refresh throughout the day, now it does not update. 
The left side does have the ‚Äúcurrent‚Äù time (HH:mm) in blue text different from the time markers. It is accurate to the point when the app is opened but does not update. (ie; if I open the app at 11:36 and have the app open, it will still say 11:36 at 12:20) I can not get it to update by selecting calendar or switching between chat/calendar, it will only get the time for calendar at the initial load. I have to force close and restart the application.

I initially thought maybe it would be something with my device, but neither restarting phone, nor uninstalling/reinstalling app has had any effect.

Obviously because it‚Äôs for work I‚Äôll continue to ‚Äúuse‚Äù the application. But this round of ‚Äúbug fixes and enhancements‚Äù is a huge pain in the neck.

title: some nitpicks, but works good
text: great for connecting with any sort of professional group, be it academic or work related, one of the issues I have is that meetings are done via the IOS phone-call system and the audio cannot be adjusted adequately over earbuds or a headset as it is always slightly too loud (especially if any single person in the meeting has a bad microphone). If they fix this then I'd give it four stars, if they let you further customize a team then I'd be more inclined to give it five.

title: The absolute worst chat experience ever devised
text: It‚Äôs inconceivable that a company with the resources of Microsoft is even capable of producing software this terrible. It is by a huge margin the worst current chat offering, but it‚Äôs also much worse than much older chat offerings like IRC or AOL instant messenger. Extremely buggy, notifications don‚Äôt work correctly, video and voice calls barely work. Truly an awful experience. I actively refuse to work places that rely on Teams.

title: Inexplicably Requires Local Network Access to do calls
text: No other similar voice app requires this (Zoom, Google Voice, WebEx) but Teams WILL NOT allow you to join via audio through the app unless you grant it local network access. This seems like poor app design and needlessly requiring users to accept less privacy for what shouldn‚Äôt be required at all (unless you need some special function like seeing and connecting to conference room equipment, but that shouldn‚Äôt impact a normal app call/audio).

title: Spies on local network
text:
It‚Äôs amazing that years have gone by now and so many have complained about this issue but Microsoft still has not fixed it. 

If you need to use this app for Teams calls and you don‚Äôt allow the app access to your local network, it instantly drops the call. 

There is absolutely NO reason for this app to have access to your local network. 

So this app will continue to get 1 star ratings for not listening to its users after all this time. 

Very disappointing.
